text: - During my computer science studies,

I took up a variety of
internships and side jobs.

I was working at a startup,
which leveraged a lot of AWS.

And here I gained my first
experience with the cloud.
When the pandemic started in 2020,

I was visiting my family
in the Netherlands.
Due to the impact of COVID-19,
I was let go by the company
and decided to stay in the Netherlands
to focus on my graduation.
A few weeks later, I was approached by AWS
for a graduate position in Poland.

And now I am a professional
service consultant
based out of Warsaw.

My role is to support
companies in using AWS.

I do this by listening to
the customer's challenges,

advise them about the
technical solutions available,

and help them implement
these in the cloud.
What I find most interesting about my work
are the unique use cases and scenarios
that we encounter every day,
since these are usually challenges
that have not been encountered before.

AWS offers opportunities
in every subcategory
of the computer science field.

This allows me to pick any
career path inside the company,

and I'm very excited to see
where my journey will take me.
